page.title: 06THE BATTLE OF LANSDOWN.
page.content: There is a Memorial at Lansdown to commemorate the Battle which took place in l643. It was between the Royalists, also called the Roundheads, and the Parliamentarians. The leader of the Roundheads who were called that because they had short hair, was Oliver Cromwell. The Leader of the Royalists was King Charles I. During part of the Battle the Roundheads retreated up to Marshfield, near Swainsick, Bath. The Commander of the Roundheads was called Ralph Hopton. He left about l000 Musketeers in the hedges and the rest of his army went up to Marshfield.When the battle was over the Roundheads moved on and King Charles 1 was beheaded and there was a Parliament .
